title: 109_hr3639
content: The "Life Insurance Fairness for Travelers Act of 2005" amends the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 to provide fairness for life insurance purchasers. Congressional findings and purposes are outlined in the new title. The "Life Insurance Fairness for Travelers Act of 2005" aims to address the issue of life insurance companies using future foreign travel plans as a reason to deny coverage or charge excessive premiums. The purpose is to establish uniform rules to prevent discrimination in life insurance policies based on future travel plans. The "Life Insurance Fairness for Travelers Act of 2005" prohibits insurers from denying life insurance or discriminating based on future lawful foreign travel plans. Insurers cannot charge excessive rates for life insurance related to the actuarial risk of such travel. Administrative enforcement is outlined in Section 403. The "Life Insurance Fairness for Travelers Act of 2005" allows State enforcement by the chief law enforcement officer or designated official. The Secretary enforces the Act in states without comparable laws. The Act does not affect State laws. The "Life Insurance Fairness for Travelers Act of 2005" allows State enforcement by designated officials. The Act does not exempt insurers from complying with State laws regarding the use of foreign travel for underwriting life insurance. The Secretary can determine inconsistencies with State laws and exempt certain insurance transactions within a State if deemed necessary. The "Life Insurance Fairness for Travelers Act of 2005" allows State enforcement by designated officials for transactions subject to similar requirements as this title or providing greater consumer protection with enforcement provisions. "SEC. 405. DEFINITIONS." "In this title, the definitions of 'insurer', 'insured', and 'life insurance' are provided. An insurer is any entity licensed to provide life insurance, an insured is a person purchasing life insurance, and life insurance includes endowment and additional benefits." The additional benefits of life insurance include death by accident coverage, disability income benefits, protection against lapse or total disability, long-term care reimbursement, burial insurance, and optional settlement modes. The term 'proceeds of life insurance' excludes property and casualty insurance, health insurance, and workers compensation insurance. The term 'Secretary' refers to the Secretary of the Treasury. The Secretary will issue regulations for the Life Insurance Fairness for Travelers Act of 2005. The regulations must be issued within 6 months of the enactment of the Act. A technical amendment is made to the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 to include a new title for fairness in life insurance purchases. Title IV of the Life Insurance Fairness for Travelers Act of 2005 prohibits discrimination in life insurance policies based on future foreign travel plans. It includes provisions for administrative enforcement, the effect on State laws, definitions, regulations, and applicability.
